text:
The Maoist menace is rearing its ugly ahead again in Odisha and Telangana after lying low for some time with the overall situation in affected States remaining “fluid,” the chief of the leading anti-Naxal operations force CRPF has said.

‘More attention needed’

Central Reserve Police Force Director-General Prakash Mishra said while the focus of anti-Naxal operations continues to be the worst Maoist violence-hit States of Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand, areas around the Andhra Pradesh-Odisha Border and those within Odisha “need more attention.”

The ex-Odisha DGP said while Naxal activity in the State had by-and-large cleared up, it is now “coming back” in the Narayanpatna area of Koraput district which borders Andhra. — PTI.
title: Maoist activity returning to Telangana, Odisha, says CRPF chief
